    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MappedBufferQueue getInstance(File file)
                                     throws FileNotFoundException,
                                            IOException
        Create an instance of MappedBufferQueue, backed by the given file.

        The file must already exist and be formatted correctly. This can be ensured using format(java.io.File, int, long).
        Parameters:
        file - The backing file for the memory-mapped BufferQueue.
        Returns:
        An instance of MappedBufferQueue.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file does not already exist.
        IOException - In case of any I/O error when trying to access the file.

      • format

        public static void format(File file,
          int maxDataLength,
          long numMessages)
                   throws IllegalStateException,
                          IOException
        Format a file to be used as a backing file for a MappedBufferQueue.

        The file must not already exist, it will be created.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to format.
        maxDataLength - The maximum length of any single data unit within this file.
        numMessages - The maximum number of unconsumed messages that this queue can contain.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the given file already exists.
        IOException - In case of any I/O error when trying to create or write to the file.

      • getInstance

        public static MappedBufferQueue getInstance(File directory,
                            String name,
                            int maxDataLength,
                            long numMessages)
                                     throws IOException
        A convention-driven factory method that will create and format the backing file if it doesn't already exist.

        This automatically constructs a name for the file that includes the important parameters like maxDataLength and numMessages. So if these parameters are changes during an application restart, a new file will get created. Warning: This could imply that there remain unconsumed data in the old file.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory in which to create the file.
        name - A base name for the file.
        maxDataLength - The maximum length of any single data unit within this file.
        numMessages - The maximum number of unconsumed messages that this queue can contain.
        Returns:
        An instance of MappedBufferQueue.
        Throws:
        IOException - In case of any I/O error when trying to create, write to or, access the file.
